content.raw: Will Pluto datasets always have a pluto.ini file? If so, I'd recommend just checking for pluto.ini and returning true if it's there. As written, it looks like this code could inadvertently return true for Orion 2 datasets.

content.raw: I'm concerned that the automated tests are passing, because when I run them locally, I get failures. I also manually verified that I can't load the "GaussianCloud" dataset, as it can't figure out the output type. Are we sure that the tests are getting run for the chombo frontend?

content.raw: I would say yes, pluto datasets should always have a pluto.ini file. I'm ok with testing only the pluto.ini file.
content.html: I would say yes, pluto datasets should always have a pluto.ini file. I'm ok with testing only the pluto.ini file.

pullrequest.title: Adding support for the pluto code

content.html:
Yeah, I'm pretty sure that's what needs to happen. When I use the following is_valid method for PlutoDataset, the existing Chombo tests all pass, and I can still load your Pluto dataset:

    @classmethod
    def _is_valid(self, *args, **kwargs):

        pluto_ini_file_exists  = False

        if type(args[0]) == type(""):
            dir_name = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(args[0]))
            pluto_ini_filename = os.path.join(dir_name, "pluto.ini")
            pluto_ini_file_exists = os.path.isfile(pluto_ini_filename)

        if pluto_ini_file_exists:
            return True

        return False

content.raw:
Once this is cleared up we will need to manually merge in this PR and Andrew's since we'll need to generate new answers for the answer tests. Thankfully, you won't need to worry about that business. 

I think what we'll do is have Andrew merge with your PR, update his PR with your changes, and then regenerate the tests using his PR.  Your PR will get merged in automatically by bitbucket when we merge his merged pull request.
content.html:
Once this is cleared up we will need to manually merge in this PR and Andrew's since we'll need to generate new answers for the answer tests. Thankfully, you won't need to worry about that business.

I think what we'll do is have Andrew merge with your PR, update his PR with your changes, and then regenerate the tests using his PR. Your PR will get merged in automatically by bitbucket when we merge his merged pull request.

pullrequest.title: Adding support for the pluto code

content.raw:
Hi Antoine,

I had some time to look in to this yesterday. Your frontend setup was fine, but there was a bug in the way the magnitude fields were created for low-dimensional datasets. This should be fixed in now PR#1186. I think your changes will be merged in soon. 

Thanks a bunch for contributing this!
content.html:
Hi Antoine,

I had some time to look in to this yesterday. Your frontend setup was fine, but there was a bug in the way the magnitude fields were created for low-dimensional datasets. This should be fixed in now PR#1186. I think your changes will be merged in soon.

Thanks a bunch for contributing this!

pullrequest.title: Adding support for the pluto code

content.html: Thanks a lot Andrew for digging into this, I did not have much time to do it in the past days and I surely would not have found this... :)

pullrequest.title: Adding support for the pluto code

description: I have sublassed the chombo frontend to be compatible with the pluto outputs. It tests whether a pluto.ini file exists, and if so use the new pluto frontend. For the time being, this is compatible with the pluto output when used with AMR in cartesian geometry, in 2D or 3D.
